title: (x) Phattstyle grafitti-like script - 08 Underground {Tom Lukacs}
content:
Hi everybody, I need your help!

Does anyone recognize this font?!

Thanx in advance

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080210043737im_/http:/typophile.com/files/phattstyle_5224.de.jpg)

 [‹ Lupe Fiasco Fontstyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20080210043737/http:/typophile.com/node/28889 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Lined font - Prisma (Mirage) (customised) {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080210043737/http:/typophile.com/node/15473 "Go to next forum topic")
author: al_x

comments.content:
Ugh - I hope you’re not using this for anything.

- Lex
Well, as far as tag-style scripts go, it’s not too bad, innit? Plus in a situation where the client really wants _that_ specific font, you sometimes don’t have much of a choice. ;^)
There will always be a market for ugly things, but at least this is better than Comic Sans ;-)

True, but I always prefer hand-lettering for this sort of style, unless (God forbid) a lot of text has to be set or the font has a ton of OT ligs and alternates. Just look at the two ’T’s in a row in the logo above and you’ll see why.

I find that a nice stencil face with paint drips and overspray can convey a hip-hop vibe just as well as a “tag” style font.

- Lex
